subsc: Compulsory pension and unemployment insurance,General public administration sector

abstracts.cdata!:
The proposed loan will support the
            recent round of pension reforms and plays an important role
            in the Country Assistance Strategy endorsed by the Board in
            December 2003. The proposed loan is considered to be part of
            the cluster of fiscal reform loans, but will be the first
            programmatic fiscal reform loan dedicated to social security
            reform. The loan will include three main components: (i) the
            December 2003 reform to the pay as you go of public sector
            workers (RPPS); (iii) initiation of comprehensive
            administrative reforms to the pay as you go of private
            sector workers (RGPS), including the recertification of
            pensioners, and initiation of disability reform through
            approval of National Program of Health and Safety at the
            Workplace; (iii) improvements in the regulatory and
            supervisory framework for private pension funds, including
            the creation of an autonomous pension supervision agency.
